criteria: Ability to identify and list appropriate trusted adults.
descriptions: The student cannot identify any trusted adults or provides inappropriate choices (e.g., peers involved in harmful behaviors).
The student identifies one adult but is unable to explain why they are trustworthy or suitable.
The student identifies 2 trusted adults but struggles to articulate reasons for their trustworthiness or appropriateness, or the choices are questionable.
The student identifies 3 trusted adults and provides basic reasons why they are trustworthy and appropriate resources.
The student identifies 4 trusted adults, providing clear and logical explanations for their trustworthiness and appropriateness, including their roles and responsibilities.

The student identifies 5 or more trusted adults, thoroughly explaining their trustworthiness, roles, and how they can provide support in situations involving self-harm or harm to others. Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding.
